snippet: Do strange nicknames confer an electoral advantage? Some candidates for office in Brazil, including Ladi Gaga, Christ of Jerusalem and several Batmans, seem to think so.
abstract: Memo from Brazil; electoral law allows Brazilians to list nicknames on the ballot when running for office; ballots for upcoming municipal elections are filled with an array of raunchy nicknames, from superheros to mangled versions of American television characters and politicians.

byline.contributor: Taylor Barnes and Lis Horta Moriconi contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Do strange nicknames confer an electoral advantage? Some candidates for office in Brazil, including Ladi Gaga, Christ of Jerusalem and several Batmans, seem to think so.

headline.seo: In Brazil, Eccentricity at the Ballot Box Is the Norm
headline.main: Where Daniel the Cuckold and Zig Zag Clown Vie for Office
headline.print_headline: Where Daniel the Cuckold and Zig Zag Clown Vie for Office
